cee52fa5c304175e714b06130802c11c.title: Team Leader
cee52fa5c304175e714b06130802c11c.summary:
About Up Club
Up Club is a social and educational program designed for young people (13+) with Down Syndrome. Our mission is to foster friendship, social skill development, and life skills training (including employment, health, fitness, financial, and independent living skills) within a fun, interactive environment.
The Opportunity
We are seeking a highly motivated Youth Leader to manage and run our events in Christchurch.
•	Commitment: Up to 6 hours per week in Term time and extra administrative time in the Term Breaks for Term planning if needed .
•	Schedule: Events run weekly on Friday evenings (6:30 PM - 8:30 PM) during term time.
•	Location: Events are held at various suitable community venues; administration is flexible and home-based.
Key Responsibilities
The Youth Leader is responsible for the professional implementation and administration of the program, including:
•	Event Facilitation: Researching, planning, budgeting, and leading engaging weekly events.
•	Team Leadership: Managing support worker rosters and leading the event team.
•	Administration & Reporting: Completing event reports, H&S forms, and maintaining social media.
•	Communication: Providing regular updates to parents/caregivers and the Board of Trustees (BOT).
•	Strategic Growth: Researching and developing new educational opportunities to present to the BOT for program enhancement.
cee52fa5c304175e714b06130802c11c.employer: New Zealand UPP Education Trust - UPP Club

9a1a795f2b0fe51a8e2b1ae3afbcd402.title: Carer - part time - special need child
9a1a795f2b0fe51a8e2b1ae3afbcd402.summary:
I am looking for someone to help care for my special needs daughter. My daughter is 15 years old and attends Northcote College. She is globally delayed and has some challenges in life, requiring help with day-to-day life tasks (for example, getting to and home from school, bathing and dressing). She would love a big sister to do fun activities with and give her a hand.  Her passions are swimming, scootering, basketball, toys, music, dogs and cats, dancing, iPad, and shopping.

While physically able, my daughter has limited verbal communication (but very expressive and engaging!) and takes a bit longer to do the things that we all take for granted. She can be described as a happy wee girl, although occasionally gets frustrated. As part of a class exercise her classmates described her as “giggly, funny, beautiful, cheeky, unique, unforgettable, bubbly and awesome”.

I work full time and so need some support. I can offer 10 - 15 hours per week, at $30 per hour, plus vehicle allowance, plus more hours during school holidays. The role will be co-shared with another carer, so provides some flexibility.

I am looking for someone who is caring, has patience and a good amount of empathy. An interest in child development, or experience with special needs children, would be an advantage. Access to a vehicle also essential. Ideally living on the North Shore (we live in Hillcrest)

Please get in touch if you think this role is for you and you would like to be part of my daughter’s journey.

79f809e22ba2d0513b4a70bff9e8dca5.title: Sourcing and Delivery Associate
79f809e22ba2d0513b4a70bff9e8dca5.summary:
Are you a graduate who is interested in a career in recruitment, and wants to learn from the best in the market?

About Younity

Younity is a market leading Technology and Business Transformation recruiter. We have an amazing team of recruiters that rank amongst the best in our industry, coupled with a huge network of candidates and long standing client relationships with some of NZ’s most well-known and successful organizations. We have invested in state-of-the-art technology that provides efficiency as well as an ability to reach an ever-broadening network of candidates. 

We are an organization that has our team at the center of everything that we do. Younity is not an organization where you come to work in isolation, we are a close-knit group that share knowledge, share responsibility and share glory! We have a huge amount of experience within our ranks, and this is experience that will be readily available ensuring that you are given the best chance of learning and developing a successful career in recruitment.

The Job

Joining us as a Sourcing and Delivery Associate, you will join an experienced team of Sourcing professionals to find great candidates for our clients. Some of your duties will include:

•	Proactively sourcing candidates using platforms such as LinkedIn, Seek, JobAdder, and AI tools.
•	Screening CVs and conducting initial phone interviews to build strong talent pools.
•	Keeping our recruitment systems up to date and humming smoothly.
•	Supporting candidate onboarding, placements, and contractor management.
•	Collaborating with colleagues and clients to arrange interviews and ensuring a seamless experience.
•	Helping improve how we work – we love efficiency and smart thinking!


You

•	A recent graduate (any discipline – we value attitude and aptitude!).
•	Tech-savvy and excited to work with AI and automation tools.
•	A great communicator who enjoys talking to people and building relationships.
•	Organized, proactive, and able to juggle multiple priorities with ease.
•	A team player who thrives in a fast-paced, fun, and sometimes high-pressure environment.
•	Someone who gets a thrill from making a deal and seeing things come together.
•	Recruitment is not for the faint-hearted! But it is also a career that rewards drive, motivation and hard work. You need to bring the right attitude and work ethic…. You get out what you put in!

Perks & Culture

•	A vibrant office with a great culture and amazing people.
•	A good starting salary, with commission structure.
•	Ongoing training and development from some of the best operators in this field.
•	Clear career pathways.
•	Regular team events and celebrations.
•	State-of-the-art technology and tools of the trade!
•	A company that genuinely cares about enriching lives, advancing business and strengthening communities.

Ready to Launch Your Career?

If you’re ready to dive into a career in recruitment and make your mark in this exciting and dynamic industry, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and let’s build something great together.

5287296db36ba867541c30a6414b511a.title: Support Mentor
5287296db36ba867541c30a6414b511a.summary:
About the Role
We are seeking a warm, grounded, and reliable person to provide support and mentorship to Joemie, a deeply loved 22-year-old who lives at home with her mum in Havelock North.
This role is centred around guidance, connection, and practical life-skills support. It requires someone who can build a trusted relationship with Joemie, encourage her growth, and help her strengthen her independence—while always respecting her autonomy.
Flexibility is a critical component of this position. Fixed hours are:
•	Tuesday 4:30 pm – 7:00 pm
•	Thursday 5:00 pm – 7:30 pm
These fixed sessions account for five hours of work each week.
The remaining five hours per week will be planned on a fortnightly basis, depending on the family’s schedule and Joemie’s needs.
Ten hours per week is the agreed minimum weekly hours for the role – however, there will certainly be weeks when Joemie requires more support and you’ll be offered additional support hours – these will be negotiated based on her needs for the fortnight ahead.   
________________________________________

Key Responsibilities
•	Build a caring and respectful relationship with Joemie based on trust and mutual respect.
•	Provide support in a way that prioritises teaching, guidance, and skill-building, rather than taking over tasks.
•	Support Joemie to prepare simple, nutritious evening meals—including travelling with her to the supermarket to select ingredients.
•	Assist with basic household tasks such as vacuuming, changing bed linen, and light cleaning.
•	Help Joemie learn and maintain healthy boundaries and safe habits on social media.
•	Identify appropriate community activities or opportunities for engagement and accompany her to explore these.
•	Spend time with Joemie at home when she is not up to going out. 
________________________________________

Essential Requirements
•	Flexibility – the family’s schedule works on a two-week cycle and includes some fluidity; the successful applicant must be able to adapt accordingly.
•	Full NZ driver’s licence and access to a safe, reliable vehicle.
•	Reside near Havelock North.
•	A positive attitude and good sense of humour.
•	Strong initiative and the ability to work independently.
•	High emotional intelligence, with the ability to read situations, respond calmly, and support Joemie respectfully.
________________________________________

Employment Arrangements
There are two options available for employment structure: Contractor or Employee.

Option 1: Contractor
•	Paid $37 per hour.
•	Responsible for managing your own tax, ACC, GST (if applicable), sick leave, holiday pay, and other entitlements.
•	Required to submit invoices for payment.

Option 2: Employee
•	Employed under an Individual Employment Agreement outlining all terms and conditions of employment.
•	Paid $28–$30 per hour.
•	Entitled to statutory leave (holiday pay, sick leave, bereavement leave, etc.) as set out in the Employment Agreement.
_______________________________________

97dd4c027f4977dd20e4b3aa27401a2a.title: Accounting/admin role
97dd4c027f4977dd20e4b3aa27401a2a.summary:
Job Title: Accounts Administrator – Civil Construction
Location: New Zealand
Employment Type: Full-time / Part-time (as required)
Reports to: Office Manager / Finance Manager / Director

About the Company
[Company Name] is a New Zealand–owned civil construction company delivering projects across earthworks, drainage, roading, and infrastructure. We are seeking an experienced Accounts Administrator to support our finance and operational teams.

Key Responsibilities
Accounts Payable
Process supplier invoices accurately and in a timely manner

Match invoices to purchase orders and job costs

Reconcile supplier statements and resolve discrepancies

Prepare weekly and monthly payment runs

Maintain strong relationships with suppliers and subcontractors

Accounts Receivable
Raise customer progress claims and final invoices

Follow up outstanding accounts and manage debtors

Process receipts and allocate payments correctly

Assist with retention tracking and release

Job Costing & Civil-Specific Tasks
Allocate costs to correct jobs, cost codes, and projects

Assist with tracking variations and project expenses

Support payroll data for field staff (timesheets, cost allocation)

Assist with subcontractor payments and contract compliance

Payroll Support (if required)
Process or assist with weekly/fortnightly payroll

Ensure compliance with NZ employment and tax requirements

Manage holiday pay, leave balances, and KiwiSaver deductions

Compliance & Administration
Assist with GST returns and IRD compliance

Maintain accurate financial records and filing systems

Support month-end and year-end processes

General office administration and reporting as required

Skills & Experience
Essential:

Previous experience in accounts administration (construction or civil preferred)

Strong understanding of accounts payable and receivable

Experience with accounting software (e.g. Xero, MYOB, Greentree, or similar)

High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Good communication and time management skills

Desirable:

Experience in civil construction or infrastructure projects

Job costing and progress claim experience

Knowledge of NZ tax, GST, and payroll processes

Familiarity with subcontractor agreements and retentions

Qualifications
Certificate or diploma in accounting, business administration, or similar (preferred but not essential)

Ready to kick off 2026 with a bang?

Have you recently completed your studies in communications or marketing and are looking for a role where you can learn on the job and work on diverse projects?

Waimate District Council is seeking a Communications Assistant to join our team on a fixed-term basis until December 2026. This is a full-time role (37.5 hours per week) where you’ll work alongside a supportive team and gain valuable hands-on experience.

Please note: This role requires you to work on-site, so living locally (or willing to relocate to Waimate) is a must.

About the Role

This is a fantastic opportunity to kick-start your career in communications! You’ll learn the ropes while helping us share the Waimate District Council story. You don’t need years of experience—just enthusiasm, creativity, a flair for writing, detail-oriented, and a willingness to learn. 

This role is all about learning on the job—you’ll be supported by a friendly team and given opportunities to grow your skills every step of the way.

We’re ideally looking for someone who can start by the end of January 2026. Please note, our office will be closed from 24 December to 4 January, so we’ll be in touch after that period.

If you’re interested or would like more information, please contact Grace Aikman.

27369fdba62bf89c29334e3778672ced.title: AI Data & Automation Specialist (Student/Casual Contract)
27369fdba62bf89c29334e3778672ced.summary:
Job Summary: AI Sales Automation Specialist
The Opportunity: We are seeking a data-driven AI Student or Junior Developer to build a proactive, predictive sales system. You will turn raw purchase data into automated revenue by predicting what customers need before they ask for it.

The Role: You will develop and deploy two key AI-driven modules:

The Smart Upsell Assistant: Using Association Rule Learning to identify product "bundles" and trigger automated SMS/email upsells (e.g., "Would you like to add cheese to your milk order for 10% off?").

The Missed Opportunity Finder: analyzing buying frequency and history to identify patterns and suggest recurring "Auto-Orders" for customers who order on a predictable cycle.

Technical Requirements:

Python: High proficiency in Pandas/NumPy for data cleaning and pattern recognition.

Automation: Experience connecting data to communication APIs (e.g., Twilio, Zapier, or Make).

Data Logic: Ability to handle messy data (typos, date formats) and build reliable predictive triggers.

The Details:

Type: Casual / Part-time Contract.

Hours: Approx. 10–20 hours per week (fully flexible including location).

Rate: Competitive hourly basis (to be negotiated).

The position is a full-time/part-time permanent position with a minimum of 30 hours per week, Monday to Friday. The pay rate will be $24 per hour.

The successful applicant will be someone who is enthusiastic about work. Who is looking for job security and shares our passion for delivering excellent customer service.

Your job duties will include :

Deliveries- Picking up courier goods from the supplier, delivering goods to customers.
Customer service
Load, unload, prepare, inspect and operate a delivery vehicle.
Assist with client queries.
Complete all required delivery paperwork.
Ensuring goods are stored and transported in conditions that will maintain their quality.
Meet delivery timeframes.
Reporting vehicle maintenance needs.
Ensuring compliance with occupational health and safety regulations.

The ideal candidate must :

Have a clean Class 1 NZ full driver's licence.
Relevant work experience will be beneficial.
Have good attention to detail.
Have good communication skills.
Be physically fit.
Undergo pre-employment drug and alcohol test, toro verification for driving
licence as a prerequisite to obtaining employment.
Have a clear criminal record.

Are you the person we are looking for? If so, submit your CV 
and a cover letter and tell us why you are the person for the job. To be considered for this role,
you must be a NZ Citizen/Resident or legally entitled to work in New Zealand.

17cba0ef98354d0237edf6111df91404.title: Content Creator (4x4, Off-Road & Action Brands)
17cba0ef98354d0237edf6111df91404.summary:
We’re hunting for a uni student who’s hungry, creative, and ready to get thrown into the deep end of real-world content creation not “pretend work experience,” but the kind of exposure you brag about on your CV for the next five years.

Action Group is a three-tiered beast (Action Tyres, Action Overland, Summit to Sea and a personal brand that’s scaling fast). We live in the world of 4x4 builds, off-road adventures, camping, commercial tyres, wild family chaos, and fast-paced entrepreneurship - and we need someone who can turn that into scroll-stopping content.

Your mission?
Become the engine behind our weekly long-form storytelling and daily short-form content, starting with Instagram and expanding into YouTube as we grow. You’ll plan it, film it, edit it, post it, repurpose it, and track the results. You’ll sit in on real business conversations, real builds, real customer journeys - and turn them into the content people can’t look away from.

You’ll also help edit education modules for an online course, support our personal brand, and jump between tyre trucks, 4x4 fitouts, camping content, and business storytelling.

If you can capture the chaos and make it look cinematic? You’re in.
